div.p: Most Fantasy RPG games, as a rule set have many genre-specific rules, that will not interest us here. As an example take Insanity Points in War Hammer 2. We are only interested in resolving skill rolls and conflicts in general. We leave the genre rules untouched. As another example, the guild structure can be added on top. The rules can also be applied to large groups of non-fantasy settings, possibly augmented by skills in the same spirit.

When applying our meta-rule — 10 points difference grant a : chance of winning — we find that many games, for example Warhammer, Harnmaster, Runequest, and Rolemaster provide approximately 4 levels. There are a lot of generalizations happening here, but basically these levels are at %, 34%, 84% and 95%. The most activity being in the middle range, we conclude that a +% bonus should be a + in our skill charts. Of course, at the edge of the scale, such a bonus is vastly more important. The purpose of these rules is to weed out such discrepencies.

We normalize any skill with respect to an uneducated, uncivilized, but healthy human of about 20-30 years of age without any training whatsoever. He has no equipment and only simple clothing. He is called the “N”ormalized “N”obody, NN for short.
Precision depends on the context, but principally you should not be more exact than %. (No more than one decimal point.) As smallest units we will use the second, the gramm and the centimeter.

The concrete play of the numbers (operations) must be given in a section with examples. This depends on the style of play. Also the need for such examples depends on the style of play. Where situations are estimated in the same manner by all participants, no reference to tables or calculations are needed. Rolling the estimated chances according to the general rules would be sufficent.

Skill Tests can be given descriptive levels, here we choose Very Easy (-20), Easy (-10), Average (0), Hard (10), Very Hard (20), Extremely Hard (30). Note that any difference of or more is regularly not worth rolling.

Skills listed explicitely are explained in descriptive terms for their levels. Many skills are grouped; where practical, they can be separated or more can be created as speciality of a more generic skill. Sometimes skills strad

Many skills, even skill groups are not listed, becaiuse their descriptions would simply consist in comparisons with other skill uses. For instance, Concealment and Search are opposed to each other or a Combat skill group would compare uses against each other. Where such comparison is sufficient to describe a skill, it is omitted.
This is intended for Animal Care, but can also be applied to humans as Healing, adapted accordingly.

ul.li: Level 0: NN knows the uses and obvious differences between domestic animals.
Level 10: With this level, proper food for an animal are known. The well-being can be discerned and fostered.
Level 20: Common illnesses of the various domestic animals are known, as well treatment thereof. Moods can easily be subdued or provoked.
Level 30: Caring for animals is second nature. Esoteric conditions can be detected and possibly treated.

div.p: Understanding animals or humans as a skill works in the same scales, even though the mechanisms are different. Some applications of the skill require additional "investments", for example providing food or mutual touch. These skills can be used without consciously (actively) doing so.

ul.li: Level 0: For NN befriending a subject without outside aid is a game of chance.
Level 10: At this level, understanding the situation from the subjects point of view can be leveraged.
Level 20: Empathy for the subject can be projected to it, appealing to the subject's unconscious.
Level 30: Instinctively foreseeing reactions of the subject to various potential actions you can adjust your actual action accordingly.

div.p: This includes Tracking, Survival, or Trapping.

ul.li: Level 0: NN can detect obvious natural markings.
Level 10: Perceive common wilderness markings and use connections between them.
Level 20: Small, older, and irregular signs are observed and used, behavior of inhabitants guessed at.
Level 30: Almost all markings, even miniscule and ephemeral, are noticed. Reasonable estimates of behavior of other denizens of the area are at your disposal.

div.p: All knowledge skills work in the same manner, regardless of how difficult it is to achieve a certain level of expertise. Keep in mind the meta-rule from the introduction. Evaluate, Navigation, Plant Biology, Animal Biology, Medicine, Alchemy, Gamble, Mechanics, Languages, Scripts, Etiquette, Art, and Music are knowledge skills. Note that not applications of knowledge are without danger. For example, using sleight-of-hand in a game of chance is usually considered unfair. Hiding such skill application often is a different skill.

ul.li: Level 0: NN barely knows that a domain for such knowledge exists. With some luck, he can guess whether a general topic belongs to that domain or not.
Level 10: With this level, the basic concepts are known, the more esoteric concepts have been heard of but cannot be applied.
Level 20: All concepts of the domain are known and can be applied with confidence. There are only a few topics escaping the grasps of this expert.
Level 30: Mastery of the subject matter as far as humanly possible. Genuine research or creation of new substance is possible.

div.p: Swim, Drive, Sail, Row, Climb, and Running all fall in this category.

ul.li: Level 0: NN knows what the discipline is about and knows his limits.
Level 10: Any equipment or common techniques can be used as intended.
Level 20: Improved equipment or special techniques can be used towards advantage.
Level 30: New equipment or techniques may be invented (usually applying only to special cases.)

div.p: Just as Knowledge skills, crafting skills come in many varieties. For example, Drawing, Music, Acting, Animal Training, Artisanry, Juweler, Engineering, Masonry, Leather working, Smithing, or Clothier.

ul.li: Level 0: NN knows, what type of tools are needed for the craft.
Level 10: Journeyman level, most tasks can be accomplished routinely.
Level 20: Mastery of the craft, can accomplish all complex tasks of the craft.
Level 30: reknown expert in the craft, may invent new techniques or tools.

div.p: Appropriate separate skills are available for different weapon groups.

ul.li: Level 0: NN knows, which weapons are appropriate for the skill and will not injure himself with them.
Level 10: Handles the weapon with ease and knows its tactics.
Level 20: Professional soldiers with veteran experience.
Level 30: Legendary mastery of the weapon, including specialized tactics.

div.p: Talents, also known as Feats or Traits, constitute modfiers to (single or different) skill rolls that apply under special circumstances. A s with Skills, Talents may overlap and sometimes appl to the same situations.
These talents include Better Hearing, Nightvision, Sharp eyes, Instinctive Orientation and Sixth Sense. These generally improve reaction skills.
Typical examples are: Ambidextrous, Flexible, Wings, Frightening, Reflexes, Natural Weapons, and Resistance against Poisons. Usually these also only apply to sports-like skills.
This section contains Fearless, Haggler, Fury, Meditation, or Total Recall. Depending on the mental state, these can range affect any skill but each talent only has a limited range.
Boosts are only valid for a limited time under certain conditions, but can otherwise fall in any of the other categories. Frenzy, Flee are typical examples.
